reactDev.title: REACT DEVELOPMENT
reactDev.desc: Component-driven React applications built for speed, scalability, and maintainability. We create single-page apps, dashboards, and interactive platforms using React 18 with hooks, context, and modern patterns for European businesses.
reactDev.longDesc:
React is the backbone of modern web development, and our team has delivered over 150 React-based projects for businesses across Europe. We build component-driven applications that are fast to develop, easy to maintain, and performant at scale. Every React project we deliver follows strict architectural patterns that keep your codebase clean as your business grows.

Our React development process starts with architecture planning. We define your component hierarchy, state management approach, and data flow before writing a single line of code. Using TypeScript throughout, we catch errors at compile time rather than in production. Our component library approach means common UI patterns are built once and reused consistently, giving your application a cohesive look and feel while reducing development time.

We specialise in React 18 features including concurrent rendering, automatic batching, and transitions. For state management, we use Zustand for its simplicity and performance, avoiding the boilerplate overhead of Redux. Styling is handled with Tailwind CSS and Radix UI primitives, giving us full design control without fighting CSS specificity issues. Framer Motion powers our animations with gesture support and layout animations that make your app feel polished and responsive.

Performance is built into every decision. We implement code splitting with React.lazy and Suspense boundaries so users only download the code they need. Image optimisation, memoisation strategies, and virtual scrolling for large datasets ensure your app stays fast regardless of content volume. Every project targets 95+ on Google Lighthouse across all four categories.

For European businesses, we build with internationalisation from the start using react-i18next. Your React application can serve customers in English, French, Dutch, and German with proper RTL support if needed. We handle locale-specific formatting for dates, numbers, and currencies. GDPR compliance is woven into the architecture with consent management, data minimisation patterns, and secure API communication.

Our React projects include comprehensive testing with Vitest for unit tests and Playwright for end-to-end testing. We set up CI/CD pipelines that run tests automatically on every commit, deploy to staging for review, and promote to production with zero downtime. You get full source code ownership, thorough documentation, and 30 days of post-launch support.

nextjsDev.title: NEXT.JS DEVELOPMENT
nextjsDev.desc: Server-rendered Next.js applications with the App Router, static generation, and edge functions. We build SEO-optimised, lightning-fast web experiences that rank on Google and convert visitors across European markets.
nextjsDev.longDesc:
Next.js is our framework of choice when SEO and performance are non-negotiable. Built on top of React, Next.js gives us server-side rendering, static site generation, and edge computing capabilities that make your website both fast for users and visible to search engines. We have delivered dozens of Next.js projects for businesses across France, the UK, Belgium, and the Netherlands.

Our Next.js development leverages the latest App Router architecture introduced in Next.js 14. This gives us nested layouts, streaming server components, and granular caching control. Server components reduce the JavaScript sent to the browser by rendering on the server, which means faster page loads and better Core Web Vitals scores. We use client components strategically only where interactivity is needed.

For content-heavy websites, we implement static generation at build time with incremental static regeneration for pages that change frequently. Product pages, blog posts, and landing pages are pre-rendered as HTML, served from a CDN, and revalidated on a schedule you define. This approach gives you the speed of a static site with the flexibility of a dynamic one.

Our Next.js projects come with built-in internationalisation using the middleware-based routing pattern. Each language gets its own URL structure with proper hreflang tags, localised metadata, and culturally adapted content. We handle locale detection, cookie-based preferences, and fallback strategies so every visitor sees content in their preferred language.

Edge functions and API routes let us build full-stack features without a separate backend. Contact forms, newsletter signups, webhook handlers, and authentication flows all run at the edge, close to your users across Europe. We integrate with Supabase for database needs, Stripe for payments, and Resend for transactional email.

Every Next.js site we build scores 95+ on Lighthouse, loads in under 2 seconds globally, and passes Core Web Vitals assessment. We deploy to Vercel or your preferred hosting platform with preview deployments for every pull request, so you can review changes before they go live. Full TypeScript coverage, comprehensive tests, and detailed documentation are standard.

typescriptDev.title: TYPESCRIPT DEVELOPMENT
typescriptDev.desc: Type-safe web applications built with TypeScript strict mode. We eliminate runtime errors, improve code maintainability, and deliver enterprise-grade reliability for businesses that demand production stability.
typescriptDev.longDesc:
TypeScript transforms JavaScript from a flexible scripting language into a robust, enterprise-grade development platform. Every project we build uses TypeScript in strict mode, catching entire categories of bugs at compile time rather than in production. For European businesses handling sensitive customer data and critical transactions, this level of reliability is not optional.

Our TypeScript approach goes beyond basic type annotations. We define comprehensive type hierarchies for your domain models, API responses, and component props. Generic types and utility types keep our code DRY while maintaining full type safety. Discriminated unions model complex business logic clearly, making impossible states unrepresentable in your codebase.

For API integration, we generate TypeScript types directly from your backend schemas. Whether you use Supabase, a REST API with OpenAPI specs, or GraphQL with codegen, your frontend types stay in sync with your backend automatically. This eliminates the entire class of bugs caused by frontend-backend type mismatches.

We combine TypeScript with Zod for runtime validation at system boundaries. User input, API responses, and environment variables are validated at runtime with schemas that also serve as TypeScript types. This dual approach gives you compile-time safety within your codebase and runtime safety at its edges.

Our TypeScript projects use path aliases, barrel exports, and strict module boundaries to keep large codebases navigable. ESLint with typescript-eslint enforces consistent patterns across your team. We configure strict compiler options including noUncheckedIndexedAccess and exactOptionalPropertyTypes for maximum safety.

The result is code that is easier to refactor, faster to onboard new developers to, and significantly less prone to production errors. Our European clients appreciate the reduced maintenance burden and faster feature delivery that comes from a well-typed codebase. Every TypeScript project includes comprehensive documentation of types, patterns, and architectural decisions.

frontendDev.title: FRONTEND DEVELOPMENT
frontendDev.desc: Expert frontend engineering with React, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. We build pixel-perfect, accessible, and responsive user interfaces that perform flawlessly across every device and browser.
frontendDev.longDesc:
Frontend development is where design meets engineering. Our frontend team bridges the gap between visual design and production code, delivering interfaces that look exactly like the mockups while performing flawlessly under real-world conditions. We serve businesses across Europe who need their digital presence to reflect the quality of their brand.

Our frontend stack is built on React and TypeScript with Tailwind CSS for styling. This combination gives us the component architecture of React, the type safety of TypeScript, and the utility-first flexibility of Tailwind. We use Radix UI primitives for accessible interactive components like dialogs, dropdowns, and tooltips, ensuring keyboard navigation and screen reader support are built in from the start.

Responsive design is not an afterthought in our process. We design mobile-first and enhance progressively for larger screens. Every component is tested across breakpoints from 320px mobile to 2560px ultra-wide displays. We use CSS container queries alongside media queries for truly responsive components that adapt to their context, not just the viewport.

Animation and micro-interaction bring interfaces to life. We use Framer Motion for orchestrated animations including page transitions, scroll-triggered reveals, and interactive hover states. Performance is carefully managed with will-change hints, GPU-accelerated properties, and reduced motion preferences for accessibility.

Cross-browser compatibility is verified across Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge on both desktop and mobile. We handle vendor prefixes, feature detection, and graceful degradation for older browsers when needed. Progressive enhancement ensures core functionality works everywhere while modern browsers get the full experience.

Every frontend project includes accessibility testing against WCAG 2.1 AA standards, Lighthouse performance audits targeting 95+ scores, and responsive testing across devices. We write Storybook stories for component documentation, Vitest unit tests for logic, and Playwright tests for critical user flows. Your frontend is delivered with clean, documented code that any competent developer can maintain.

pwa.title: PROGRESSIVE WEB APPS
pwa.desc: Progressive web applications that combine the best of web and native apps. Offline support, push notifications, and installable experiences that work across all devices without app store distribution.
pwa.longDesc:
Progressive web apps bridge the gap between websites and native mobile apps. They load in the browser like a website but can be installed on the home screen, work offline, and send push notifications. For European businesses that need mobile reach without the cost and friction of app store development, PWAs are the smart choice.

Our PWA development uses service workers to cache critical assets and enable offline functionality. Your users can browse products, read content, and even fill out forms without an internet connection. When connectivity returns, data syncs automatically. This is especially valuable for businesses with users in areas with unreliable connectivity or for field workers who need mobile access.

The installation experience is seamless. Users visiting your website on mobile see an install prompt that adds your app to their home screen in one tap. No app store required, no download wait, no storage warnings. Your PWA launches in full-screen mode with your brand colours and splash screen, indistinguishable from a native app.

Push notifications re-engage users with timely, relevant messages. Order updates, appointment reminders, new content alerts, and promotional campaigns reach users directly on their devices. We implement notification preferences so users control what they receive, respecting both their preferences and GDPR requirements.

Performance is exceptional because PWAs load from local cache after the first visit. Subsequent page loads are near-instant, and navigation feels native with smooth transitions and responsive touch interactions. We optimise asset caching strategies to balance freshness with speed, ensuring users always see current content without sacrificing performance.

Our PWA stack includes Workbox for service worker management, the Web Push API for notifications, and the Cache API for intelligent asset caching. We test across Android and iOS, handling platform-specific quirks like iOS home screen limitations. Analytics track PWA-specific metrics including install rates, offline usage, and push notification engagement.

apiDev.title: API DEVELOPMENT
apiDev.desc: Secure, scalable APIs built with Node.js, Supabase Edge Functions, and modern architectural patterns. We design RESTful and GraphQL APIs that power web and mobile applications for European businesses.
apiDev.longDesc:
APIs are the backbone of modern web applications. Whether you need to power a frontend application, connect mobile apps to your backend, or integrate third-party services, a well-designed API makes everything possible. We build APIs that are secure, fast, well-documented, and built to scale with your business.

Our primary API platform is Supabase, which provides auto-generated REST and GraphQL APIs from your PostgreSQL database schema. This means you get a fully functional API in a fraction of the time it takes to build one from scratch. We extend Supabase with Edge Functions for custom business logic, webhook handlers, and third-party integrations that run close to your users across Europe.

For projects requiring custom API architecture, we build with Node.js and Express or Hono frameworks. RESTful API design follows industry best practices with proper HTTP methods, status codes, pagination, filtering, and error responses. We implement rate limiting, request validation with Zod, and comprehensive error handling so your API is robust in production.

Authentication and authorisation are critical. We implement JWT-based authentication with refresh token rotation, OAuth2 flows for social login, and API key management for third-party access. Row-level security policies in PostgreSQL ensure data isolation between users and tenants without relying solely on application logic.

API documentation is generated automatically from TypeScript types and Zod schemas using tools like Swagger and OpenAPI. Your frontend team, mobile developers, and integration partners get interactive documentation with request examples, response schemas, and authentication guides. We also provide Postman collections for easy testing.

Performance is optimised with connection pooling, query optimisation, response caching, and CDN integration for static responses. We implement health checks, structured logging, and error tracking with tools like Sentry. Every API is deployed with automated tests that run before each deployment to prevent regressions.

legacyMod.title: LEGACY MODERNISATION
legacyMod.desc: Migrate your legacy website from WordPress, jQuery, or outdated frameworks to a modern React and Next.js architecture. Zero-downtime migration with full SEO preservation for European businesses.
legacyMod.longDesc:
Legacy technology holds your business back. Slow page loads, security vulnerabilities, limited mobile experience, and mounting maintenance costs are symptoms of an outdated tech stack. Our legacy modernisation service moves your website from old technology to a modern, maintainable, and performant architecture without disrupting your business.

We have migrated websites from WordPress, Drupal, Joomla, custom PHP, jQuery-based sites, and Angular 1.x applications to modern React and Next.js architectures. Each migration follows a proven methodology that preserves your SEO rankings, maintains URL structures, and ensures zero downtime during the transition.

The modernisation process starts with a thorough audit of your existing system. We document every page, URL, redirect, form, integration, and piece of custom functionality. This creates a complete migration checklist that ensures nothing is lost in translation. We identify which features should be rebuilt, which can be simplified, and which are no longer needed.

Our migration approach is incremental when possible. Using the strangler fig pattern, we can replace sections of your old site one at a time while both systems run in parallel. This reduces risk and allows you to see improvements immediately rather than waiting for a complete rebuild. Critical features like contact forms and e-commerce functionality are migrated first.

SEO preservation is a primary concern throughout the migration. We create comprehensive redirect maps, migrate all metadata, preserve internal linking structures, and submit updated sitemaps to Google. We monitor Search Console throughout the migration to catch and fix any indexation issues quickly. Our clients typically see SEO improvements after migration due to better performance and cleaner markup.

The end result is a modern, fast, secure website that costs less to maintain and is easier to extend with new features. You get full source code ownership, comprehensive documentation, and a development environment that makes future changes straightforward. Most legacy modernisation projects show a 40-60% reduction in ongoing maintenance costs within the first year.

headlessCms.title: HEADLESS CMS
headlessCms.desc: Content management solutions decoupled from the frontend. We implement Payload CMS, Strapi, and Sanity with React frontends, giving editors full control while developers maintain performance and flexibility.
headlessCms.longDesc:
Traditional CMS platforms force you to choose between editor experience and frontend performance. Headless CMS eliminates this trade-off by separating content management from content presentation. Your marketing team gets a familiar editing interface while your website runs on modern, blazing-fast frontend technology.

We implement headless CMS solutions using Payload CMS as our primary platform, with Strapi and Sanity as alternatives depending on your requirements. Payload CMS is our top recommendation because it is built with TypeScript, self-hosted for full data control, and infinitely customisable. For European businesses concerned about data sovereignty, self-hosting means your content data stays within the EU.

The content modelling phase is critical. We design your content types, fields, and relationships to match how your team thinks about content. Blog posts, case studies, team members, services, FAQ sections — each content type gets a tailored editing experience with validation, preview, and publishing workflows. Rich text editors support embedding images, videos, and custom components.

On the frontend, content is fetched via API and rendered with React or Next.js. Static generation means content changes are reflected on your website within seconds of publishing while serving pre-built HTML for maximum performance. We implement preview modes so editors can see exactly how content will look before publishing.

Multilingual content management is built into every headless CMS setup. Editors can manage content in English, French, Dutch, and German from a single interface with proper locale fallbacks and translation workflows. The frontend automatically routes users to the correct language based on URL structure and browser preferences.

Access control ensures the right people can edit the right content. Editors manage blog posts, administrators control settings, and developers handle templates. Audit trails track every change, and version history allows rolling back to any previous state. Media management includes image optimisation, focal point selection, and responsive image generation.

perfOpt.desc: Speed up your website with Core Web Vitals optimisation, code splitting, image compression, and caching strategies. We guarantee 95+ Lighthouse scores and sub-2-second load times.
perfOpt.longDesc:
Website speed directly impacts your bottom line. Research consistently shows that every 100ms of additional load time costs 1% in conversion rate. For European e-commerce businesses, that can mean thousands of euros in lost revenue each month. Our performance optimisation service identifies and eliminates every bottleneck slowing your website down.

We start with a comprehensive performance audit using Lighthouse, WebPageTest, and Chrome DevTools. We measure Core Web Vitals including Largest Contentful Paint, First Input Delay, Cumulative Layout Shift, and Interaction to Next Paint. Each metric is benchmarked against your competitors and industry standards so you know exactly where you stand.

Image optimisation often delivers the biggest wins. We implement next-gen formats like WebP and AVIF with automatic fallbacks, responsive images with srcset for different screen sizes, lazy loading for below-the-fold content, and proper width and height attributes to prevent layout shifts. For hero images and LCP elements, we use priority loading to ensure they appear instantly.

JavaScript is the second biggest performance bottleneck. We implement code splitting to break your bundle into smaller chunks loaded on demand. Tree shaking eliminates unused code. Dynamic imports defer heavy libraries until they are needed. We audit third-party scripts and remove or defer those that block rendering. Bundle analysis identifies the largest dependencies and finds lighter alternatives.

Server-side optimisation includes proper cache headers, CDN configuration, Brotli compression, and edge computing for dynamic content. Database queries are optimised with proper indexing, query planning, and connection pooling. API responses are cached at multiple levels to reduce server load and improve response times.

Font loading is optimised with font-display: swap, subsetting to include only needed characters, and preloading critical font files. CSS is purged of unused styles and critical CSS is inlined in the document head. The result is a website that paints meaningful content in under 1 second and becomes fully interactive in under 2 seconds on a 4G connection.

a11y.title: WEB ACCESSIBILITY
a11y.desc: Make your website accessible to everyone with WCAG 2.1 AA compliance audits and remediation. We ensure keyboard navigation, screen reader support, and EU accessibility directive compliance.
a11y.longDesc:
Web accessibility is both a legal requirement and a business opportunity. The European Accessibility Act requires digital services to be accessible by June 2025. Beyond compliance, accessible websites reach a wider audience, perform better in search results, and provide a better experience for all users, not just those with disabilities.

Our accessibility service starts with a thorough audit against WCAG 2.1 AA standards. We test with automated tools like axe-core and Lighthouse, but the real value comes from manual testing. We navigate your entire site using only a keyboard, test with screen readers including NVDA and VoiceOver, check colour contrast ratios, verify focus management, and assess content structure.

The audit produces a prioritised remediation plan. Critical issues that prevent access to core functionality are fixed first. These include missing alt text on images, form inputs without labels, keyboard traps, and missing focus indicators. We then address medium-priority issues like heading hierarchy, link text, ARIA usage, and touch target sizes.

Our remediation work is thorough. We implement proper semantic HTML structure with landmarks, headings, and ARIA attributes. Interactive components like modals, accordions, and menus receive full keyboard support with proper focus trapping and escape key handling. Forms get associated labels, error messages connected with aria-describedby, and live regions for dynamic feedback.

Colour and visual accessibility is addressed by ensuring all text meets minimum contrast ratios, providing focus indicators that are visible against all backgrounds, and supporting reduced-motion preferences for users who are sensitive to animation. We never rely solely on colour to convey information.

Post-remediation, we provide your team with an accessibility statement for your website, documentation of accessible patterns used, and training on maintaining accessibility as you add new content and features. We can also set up automated accessibility testing in your CI/CD pipeline to catch regressions before they reach production.

Crawlability and indexation determine which pages Google can find and include in search results. analyticsSetup.title: ANALYTICS SETUP
analyticsSetup.desc: Professional Google Analytics 4 setup with Consent Mode v2, custom events, conversion tracking, and GDPR-compliant reporting dashboards for data-driven European businesses.
analyticsSetup.longDesc:
Analytics is the foundation of data-driven decision making. Without proper tracking, you cannot measure what works, identify what fails, or optimise your marketing spend. Our analytics setup service implements Google Analytics 4 with the depth and accuracy that European businesses need for compliant, insightful reporting.

GA4 configuration goes far beyond adding a tracking script. We set up your property with proper data streams, configure cross-domain tracking if needed, and implement enhanced measurement for scroll depth, outbound clicks, video engagement, and file downloads. Custom dimensions and metrics capture business-specific data that standard events do not cover.

Google Consent Mode v2 is mandatory for European websites using Google Analytics. We implement consent integration with your cookie management platform so GA4 respects user choices. When users decline analytics cookies, GA4 runs in cookieless mode with modelled conversions. When they consent, full tracking activates. This ensures GDPR compliance while maintaining useful data.

Custom event tracking captures the specific user actions that matter to your business. Form submissions, CTA clicks, phone number clicks, pricing page views, demo bookings, file downloads, and video plays are all tracked as named events with relevant parameters. These events feed into conversion goals and audience segments.

Conversion tracking connects your analytics to business outcomes. We set up conversion events for your key objectives whether they are contact form submissions, purchases, phone calls, or booking confirmations. Google Ads conversion import links your paid campaigns directly to these outcomes for accurate ROI measurement.

Reporting dashboards transform raw data into actionable insights. We build custom Looker Studio dashboards that show traffic sources, user behaviour, conversion performance, and campaign results in a clear, visual format. Dashboards are shared with your team and stakeholders, with automated email delivery on your preferred schedule.

Data quality assurance ensures your analytics are accurate from day one. We test every event, verify conversion tracking, check referral exclusions, filter internal traffic, and validate cross-domain tracking. A data quality audit document confirms everything is working correctly before we hand over.

uxUiDesign.title: UX/UI DESIGN
uxUiDesign.desc: User-centred UX/UI design with research, wireframing, prototyping, and pixel-perfect interface design. We create digital experiences that delight users and drive conversions for European businesses.
uxUiDesign.longDesc:
Great design is invisible. Users do not notice good UX because everything works as expected. They notice bad UX immediately. Our UX/UI design service creates digital experiences where users accomplish their goals effortlessly, resulting in higher conversion rates, longer engagement, and stronger brand perception for your European business.

User research grounds every design decision in evidence. We conduct stakeholder interviews to understand business goals, user interviews to understand customer needs, and competitive analysis to identify industry benchmarks. For European projects, we research cross-cultural differences in design expectations. German users expect different information density than French users. British users have different trust signals than Dutch users.

Information architecture defines how content is organised and navigated. We create sitemaps and user flow diagrams that map every path through your digital product. Card sorting exercises with real users validate our navigation structure. The goal is a structure where users find what they need in three clicks or fewer.

Wireframing translates architecture into layout. Low-fidelity wireframes establish content hierarchy, component placement, and interaction patterns without the distraction of visual design. We wireframe for mobile, tablet, and desktop simultaneously, ensuring responsive design is considered from the start, not bolted on later.

Visual design brings wireframes to life with your brand identity. We design pixel-perfect interfaces in Figma with consistent spacing, typography, colour usage, and component patterns. Design systems ensure every element follows the same rules, making the interface feel cohesive and professional. Dark themes, light themes, and accessibility modes are designed as needed.

Prototyping lets you experience the design before development begins. Interactive Figma prototypes simulate real user flows including page transitions, form interactions, and state changes. Usability testing with prototypes reveals issues that static mockups miss. We iterate until the design is validated by real user feedback.

Design handoff to developers is comprehensive. Every component is documented with specifications for spacing, colours, typography, states, and responsive behaviour. Developers receive organised Figma files with proper naming conventions, auto-layout, and component variants that map directly to code implementation.

digitalStrategy.title: DIGITAL STRATEGY
digitalStrategy.desc: Comprehensive digital strategy consulting with market analysis, competitor research, channel planning, and actionable roadmaps. We help European businesses define and execute their digital growth plan.
digitalStrategy.longDesc:
Digital strategy answers the fundamental question: how should your business grow online? Without a strategy, digital efforts become a collection of disconnected tactics. Our digital strategy consulting connects your business objectives to specific digital initiatives, channels, and metrics, creating a clear roadmap for sustainable online growth.

Market analysis establishes the landscape. We research your industry's digital maturity, identify how customers find and evaluate providers like you, and map the competitive landscape across your target European markets. This analysis reveals which channels drive the most value, where competitors are vulnerable, and what opportunities are underexploited.

Competitor research goes deep. We analyse competitors' websites, content strategies, SEO performance, paid advertising, social media presence, and conversion tactics. This is not about copying what they do. It is about understanding what works in your market so we can differentiate your approach and find gaps they have missed.

Channel strategy defines where to invest your digital budget and effort. We evaluate the potential of organic search, paid search, social media, email marketing, content marketing, and partnerships based on your specific business, audience, and goals. Each recommended channel includes expected ROI, resource requirements, and timeline to results.

Roadmap creation translates strategy into quarterly action plans. Each quarter has defined initiatives, responsible teams, budget allocations, and success metrics. The roadmap is realistic about resources and prioritises high-impact activities that build on each other. Quick wins are identified for early momentum alongside longer-term investments.

KPI framework ensures progress is measurable. We define leading indicators that predict success and lagging indicators that confirm it. Monthly scorecard reviews track progress against targets, and quarterly strategy reviews adjust the plan based on what the data shows. This disciplined approach ensures your digital investment delivers measurable business outcomes.

For European businesses operating across multiple markets, digital strategy addresses market prioritisation, resource allocation between countries, and coordination of multi-market campaigns. We help you decide where to invest first, when to expand, and how to adapt your approach for each market's unique characteristics.

brandIdentity.title: BRAND IDENTITY
brandIdentity.desc: Professional brand identity design including logo, colour palette, typography, and brand guidelines. We create distinctive visual identities that position European businesses for premium market perception.
brandIdentity.longDesc:
Your brand identity is the visual language that communicates who you are before a single word is read. A strong brand identity creates instant recognition, builds trust, and positions your business as professional and credible. Our brand identity service creates cohesive visual systems that work across digital and print touchpoints for European businesses.

Brand strategy precedes design. Before sketching logos, we define your brand positioning, personality, and values. Who are your customers? What makes you different from competitors? What feeling should your brand evoke? These strategic decisions guide every design choice and ensure your visual identity supports your business objectives.

Logo design is the centrepiece of brand identity. We develop multiple logo concepts exploring different directions, then refine the chosen concept through iterative feedback. Each logo works in full colour, single colour, reversed, and small formats. We create primary, secondary, and icon versions to ensure flexibility across all applications.

Colour palette selection is systematic. We choose a primary colour that reflects your brand personality, supporting colours for hierarchy and variety, and neutral tones for text and backgrounds. Each colour is specified in HEX, RGB, CMYK, and Pantone values for consistency across digital and print. Accessibility testing ensures sufficient contrast for all text combinations.

Typography pairs are selected for both impact and readability. We recommend display and body font combinations from premium foundries, Google Fonts, or open-source libraries. Font scales define sizes for headings, body text, captions, and UI elements across devices. Weight and style usage rules prevent the visual chaos that undermines many brand identities.

Brand guidelines document everything in a comprehensive, usable format. Logo usage rules with clear space, minimum sizes, and prohibited modifications. Colour specifications with primary, secondary, and accent palettes. Typography scales and pairing rules. Photography and illustration style direction. Tone of voice guidelines for written content. These guidelines ensure consistency as your business grows and more people create branded materials.

designSystems.title: DESIGN SYSTEMS
designSystems.desc: Scalable design systems with reusable UI components, design tokens, and comprehensive documentation. We build the foundation for consistent, efficient product development at scale.
designSystems.longDesc:
A design system is the single source of truth for how your digital products look, feel, and behave. It eliminates inconsistency, reduces development time, and ensures every new feature or page automatically aligns with your established patterns. For growing European businesses building multiple digital products, a design system is an investment that pays for itself quickly.

Design tokens are the atomic building blocks. We define colours, spacing, typography, shadows, border radii, and breakpoints as tokens that flow from design tools to code. When you decide to adjust your primary colour or increase base spacing, the change propagates everywhere automatically. Tokens are documented in a format that both designers and developers understand.

Component libraries bring tokens together into reusable UI elements. Buttons, inputs, cards, modals, navigation, tables, and dozens more components are designed with every state and variant accounted for. Each component handles hover, focus, active, disabled, loading, and error states. Responsive behaviour and accessibility are built into every component from the start.

In Figma, components use auto-layout, variants, and component properties so designers can build pages by assembling components rather than drawing from scratch. Consistent naming conventions match between Figma and code, making design-to-development handoff seamless. Designers drag in a Button component and developers use the matching Button React component.

In code, the design system is implemented as a React component library with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Radix UI primitives. Each component is fully typed with proper props interfaces, supports theming through CSS custom properties, and includes comprehensive accessibility features. Storybook documents every component with interactive examples and usage guidelines.

Governance ensures the design system stays healthy as it grows. We establish contribution guidelines, review processes, and versioning strategies. New components follow a proposal, design, build, and release workflow. Breaking changes are communicated clearly with migration guides. The design system serves your team, not the other way around.

prototyping.title: RAPID PROTOTYPING
prototyping.desc: Interactive prototypes from concept to clickable demo in days, not weeks. Validate ideas with real users before committing to full development, saving time and budget on your European digital projects.
prototyping.longDesc:
Prototyping is the fastest way to validate an idea before investing in full development. Instead of spending months building a product that might miss the mark, a prototype lets you test core concepts with real users in days. Our rapid prototyping service turns your ideas into interactive demos that look and feel like real products.

We prototype at different fidelity levels depending on what you need to validate. Low-fidelity wireframe prototypes test information architecture and user flows. They answer questions like: can users find what they need? Does the navigation make sense? Is the page structure logical? These prototypes are built in hours and tested the same day.

Medium-fidelity prototypes add visual design and interactive elements. They test the look and feel alongside the functionality. Users can click through realistic screens, fill out forms, and experience transitions. These prototypes answer: does the design communicate the right message? Are interactive elements intuitive? Does the visual hierarchy guide attention correctly?

High-fidelity prototypes are nearly indistinguishable from real products. Built in Figma with smart animate transitions and realistic data, or coded with React and mock data, these prototypes can be used for investor demos, stakeholder presentations, and detailed usability testing. They answer: would users actually use this product? What needs to change before development?

Usability testing with prototypes reveals issues that no amount of internal review can catch. We recruit participants matching your target audience, write test scripts, facilitate sessions, and analyse results. Testing can be conducted in English, French, Dutch, or German depending on your target market. Five users typically reveal 85% of usability issues.

Prototype insights directly inform the development specification. Instead of building from a static design, your development team builds from a tested, validated prototype. This dramatically reduces the number of changes needed during and after development. The prototype also serves as a reference point for design QA, ensuring the final product matches the validated experience.

faq.webDev1Q: How long does it take to build a website?
faq.webDev1A: A single-page site takes 3-5 business days. A multi-page site with 5-7 pages takes 7-10 days. Complex projects with multilingual support take 14-18 days. We always deliver on time.
faq.webDev2Q: What technologies do you use for web development?
faq.webDev2A: We use React 18, Next.js 14, Vite, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. For animations, we use Framer Motion. Every site is built with performance and SEO as core priorities.
faq.webDev3A: Yes, every website we build is fully responsive. We test on mobile, tablet, and desktop to ensure a perfect experience on all devices. Mobile-first design is our standard approach.
faq.webDev4Q: What is included in the 30 days of free support?
faq.webDev4A: Bug fixes, minor content updates, and technical support via email. For ongoing maintenance including hosting, security updates, and monthly reports, see our Care Plan at €97/month.
faq.ecommerce1Q: Which payment providers do you integrate?
faq.ecommerce1A: We integrate Stripe (for card payments across Europe), LemonSqueezy (for digital products), and can add local payment methods like iDEAL (Netherlands), Bancontact (Belgium), or Klarna.
faq.ecommerce2Q: Can you build a multilingual online store?

faq.ecommerce3Q: How do you handle inventory management?

faq.ecommerce4Q: What about GDPR compliance for e-commerce?
faq.ecommerce4A: All our e-commerce sites include GDPR-compliant cookie consent, privacy policies, data processing agreements, and secure customer data handling. We follow EU data protection regulations.
faq.seo1Q: How quickly will I see SEO results?
faq.seo1A: Technical fixes show impact within 2-4 weeks. Content and keyword optimizations typically take 2-3 months to show ranking improvements. SEO is a long-term investment with compounding returns.
faq.seo2Q: Do you guarantee first page rankings?

faq.seo3Q: What is included in the monthly SEO report?

faq.seo4A: Yes. We implement proper hreflang tags, create localized keyword strategies, and optimize content for each language market. Each language version gets its own SEO attention.
faq.marketing1Q: What is your minimum ad budget recommendation?
faq.marketing1A: For Google Ads, we recommend a minimum of €500/month per market. This gives enough data for optimization. Our management fee starts at €247/month on top of ad spend.
faq.marketing2Q: Which social media platforms do you manage?
faq.marketing2A: We focus on LinkedIn for B2B, Instagram for visual brands, and Facebook for local businesses. We recommend choosing 2-3 platforms rather than spreading too thin.
faq.marketing3Q: How do you measure marketing ROI?
